text.0: sing like the two pressstones for this same purpose come like two misers to the tree of treasure.
text.1: like two laudsinging brahmans in the assembly like the folks envoys called in many places.
text.2: moving at morning like two carborne heroes like to a pair of goats ye come electing.
text.3: like two fair dames embellishing their bodies like a wise married pair among the people.
text.4: like to a pair of horns come first to usward like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion.
text.5: come like two cakavās in the grey of morning come like two chariot wheels at dawn ye mighty.
text.6: bear us across the rivers like two vessels save us as ye were yokes naves spokes and fellies.
text.7: be like two dogs that injure not our bodies preserve us like two crutches that we fall not.
text.8: like two winds ageing not two confluent rivers come with quick vision like two eyes before us.
text.9: come like two hands most helpful to the body and guide us like two feet to what is precious.
text.10: even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey even as two breasts that nourish our existence.
text.11: like the two nostrils that protect our being be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.
text.12: like two hands give ye us increasing vigour like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions.
text.13: aśvins these hymns that struggle to approach you sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.
text.14: these prayers of ours exalting you o aśvins have the gṛtsamadas for a laud made ready.
text.15: welcome them o ye heroes and come hither loud may we speak with brave men in assembly.
